projects.title: Heartville / Supportr (version 1)
projects.description:
For Qlvr I was part of the development team for Heartville / Supportr, from the first technical prototype till the first version of the application, game and coach-tool.

HeartVille is a social game that helps people to persevere in their lifestyle improvement. The initial target group will be psychiatric patients, who’s life expectancy is 25 years (!) less than the average population, mainly because of their lifestyle.

Heartville is a blended healthcare solution that combines the benefits of a support group, social media and gameplay to help players achieve their personal lifestyle goals. Players will be grouped together in a real time social game where they are challenged to restore the ruined village of Heartville into a paradise. But there’s a catch: to obtain the needed tools and objects tot build up your world, you need to fulfill your personal lifestyle goals. The social encouragement of your group as well as the short-term gratification of the game helps you to keep making the right choices.

HeartVille is complementary to an existing and proven lifestyle coach program called ‘TrafficLight’. The development of the game will be based on scientific research and testing within a psychiatric hospital of GGz Central under guidance of Prof. Peter van Harten. After the initial development, the game can easily be modified to cater different target groups, such as obese adolescents or heart patients.

projects.title: WUR - EnergySim
projects.description:
client: Qlvr & Wageningen UR

An educational interactive web application that simulates the economic principles regarding various energy sources and their long term impact on C02 emission and costs.

The application consists of a reactive form, a visual simulation and a complex graph, which together gives students insight into this complex concept, as part of a study program.

contributors.headline: Owner at Frank Douwes - Creative Design & Development

projects.title: Heartlive
projects.description:
A suite of desktop applications (using Adobe AIR). Heartlive allows users to train their heart coherence (HRV) using a specialized ear sensor. The applications consist of simple training applications and monitoring applications using real time heart sensor data.

For this project I developed 3 applications and a cross application user syncing solution.

I was also responsible for the design of the applications (based on a partial design by a previous designer), design of the website, and the packaging design.

contributors.headline: Owner at Frank Douwes - Creative Design & Development

projects.title: Oma is de weg kwijt
projects.description:
HKU graduation project 2009 A multitouch application for primary education, a set of interactive history lessons using new media to link personal history to the history of the Netherlands.

an interactive history teaching package for primary education using multi-touch technologies. which aims to connect the child’s personal family history with the history of the Netherlands.

I was responsible for concept design, interaction design, and technical development (touch screen + web applications in Actionscript)

contributors.headline: Owner at Frank Douwes - Creative Design & Development

projects.title: Virus Free Generation -
projects.description:
The Virus Free Generation Hip-Hop Tour is a project by Hivos, Alliance 2015 and Music Mayday attempting to raise awareness about the HIV&Aids epidemic in Africa amongst the European youth of Germany, the Netherlands, Czech Republic and Italy. It started in February 2008 in Dar es Salam (Tanzania) and ended in Cape Town (South Africa) in April 2008. 

In each country a duo was formed containing of a European and an African Hip-Hop artist. Together they visited HIV&Aids related youth projects, gave workshops to local youth and musicians on how to use music as a tool of expression and education and gave a free concert where the local youth got a change to show their talent. They also recorded 3 tracks for the album and recorded a music video together with the media team. 

I was part of the media team that traveled along with the artists to capture all of the activities, and was responsible for video editing, tour photography and web design/maintenance. 

The virus free generation hip-hop tour could be followed live on the website, which was updated daily from Africa with Photos, Videos (webisodes) and a Blog. I also created most of the print design for the campaign surrounding the european part of the tour.

projects.title: BUY
projects.description:
BUY? was an ubiquitous computing experiment, the goal was to create a whole new shopping experience, where the user was presented with relevant information previously unavailable. To accomplish this we chose to make the user interface controls almost completely sensor based (using infrared LEDs, augmented reality QR tags and an ultrasonic sensor), the GUI is a combination of the persons reflection in the mirror combined with floating elements projected around it, due to the nature of the specially coated mirror it’s impossible to see how this effect is achieved, where the projection is coming from and where the edges are. A truly unique experience that is hard to describe.

I created the interface elements and a total of 12 short content videos for the first prototype of the BUY? installation, the interface has 3 icons, each representing a different pathway the user can choose, Concept (Light Bulb icon), Production (Sprocket icon) and Social (Heart icon). Concept shows the idea behind the print on the shirt, where the idea originated and the designers opinion or statement. Production visualises the production process and the materials used. Social shows information about the people who bought the shirt, their lifestyle and their opinion about the product.

I helped develop the motion tracking system (using AR in Actionscript), and designed the flyer/poster to help promote the project.

contributors.headline: Owner at Frank Douwes - Creative Design & Development

projects.title: Leave your trace / Share your story
projects.description:
Leave your trace gives visitors of the Red Star Line Museum (in Antwerp – Belgium) the chance to become part of the migration story the museum exhibits. 

Visitors fill out a simple form, take a picture and instantly become part of an animation that sends the visitor on a journey to America. The user image is masked and integrated into a beautiful animation that can be shared with friends via. social-media.

For this Project I developed 2 AIR applications, an API, and a website that allows visitors to watch/share their personalized animations.

Share your story is a web application (HTML5/JS/PHP) that allows visitors to share their migration story with the red star line museum. consisting of a complex web form with media upload, and a pdf generator.
